Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கையறி யாமை உடைத்தே பொருள்கொடுத்து மெய்யறி யாமை கொளல்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To give money and purchase unconsciousness is the result of one's ignorance of (one's own actions).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown handing over a bag of precious gold coins ('பொருள் கொடுத்து').
Layered_Composition.Midground: In exchange, they are receiving a dark, murky liquid in a bottle. This liquid represents self-oblivion or unconsciousness ('மெய்யறியாமை').
Layered_Composition.Background: This transaction is depicted as an act of profound ignorance and lack of self-awareness ('கையறியாமை'). The person is essentially paying to destroy their own consciousness, which is shown to be the ultimate foolish bargain.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The act of paying money to purchase a substance that makes you lose awareness of yourself is the very definition of ignorant action.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The transaction—gold for a bottle of oblivion—is the central image. This frames addiction as a foolish commercial exchange.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dim, sordid light, as if in a back alley. The gold has a last gleam of value before it is exchanged for the dark, worthless liquid of oblivion.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A close-up on the exchange of goods, focusing on the foolishness of the transaction.

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: a person receiving wisdom for money, text artifacts, cartoonish.
